subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: QS news update
msgSnippet: ... The entries for implements are as follows: IMPLEMENT  IH1 M P L AH0 M AH0 N T IMPLEMENTATION  IH2 M P L AH0 M EH0 N T EY1 SH AH0 N IMPLEMENTED  IH1 M P L
messageBody:
John Cowan wrote:
>
>
> Anthony Hagan scripsit:
>
> > As I said in post 1467, I don't like the dropped #3Tea in many QS
> > news words. An example is "implementing" which was converted
> > to ...#28Et-#23No-#26It-#21iNG. Should we put the #3Tea in (to
> > get ...#28Et-#23No-#3Tea-#26It-#21iNG), or is the dropped #3Tea a
> > widespread Americanism which should remain?
>
> Not that I know of. But the CMU dictionary lists this as IH M P L AH
> M EH N T IH NG, which maps to It-May-Pea-Low-Ah-May-Et-No-Tea-It-Ing.
> So I can't imagine where the dropped T is coming from; definitely not
> the dictionary itself.

The entries for implements are as follows:

IMPLEMENT IH1 M P L AH0 M AH0 N T
IMPLEMENTATION IH2 M P L AH0 M EH0 N T EY1 SH AH0 N
IMPLEMENTED IH1 M P L AH0 M EH2 N T AH0 D
IMPLEMENTED(2) IH1 M P L AH0 M EH2 N AH0 D
IMPLEMENTING IH1 M P L AH0 M EH2 N T IH0 NG
IMPLEMENTING(2) IH1 M P L AH0 M EH2 N IH0 NG
IMPLEMENTS IH1 M P L AH0 M AH0 N T S


You can see that the T is dropped in two of the words

Paul
